headline: Teriyaki Chicken
description: Sweetened soy sauce spiked with lots of fresh ginger and garlic make an easy, pungent teriyaki chicken.
name: Teriyaki Chicken
recipeIngredient: 1 (3 pound) whole chicken, cut in half

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse chicken halves, and pat dry with paper towels. Place chicken cut side down in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
In a medium mixing bowl, combine sugar, soy sauce, grated ginger and garlic. Mix well, and pour mixture over chicken. Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Bake chicken uncovered in the preheated oven for 1 hour, basting frequently. Test for doneness, making sure there is no pink left in the meat. Let cool slightly, then cut into smaller pieces to serve.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely delicious! This is an amazingly easy but yummy teriyaki chicken recipe! It’s just as good or better than any Chinese restaurant I’ve ever been to. My mom used to make this exact recipe growing up. My brothers and sister and I all loved it. And now I’m privileged to be able to have and make this myself! Thank you to whomever it may concern. Also, my husband loved it too, so it’s a winner. We will be making this one of our regulars.
I used brown sugar instead of white sugar and grilled the chicken. Very tasty.
This was delicious! I followed the recipe as is with the exception of the garlic. I used a little cumin instead. I also used chicken drumsticks since it was all I had at the time.

I don't eat sugar, so I substituted Lakanto Golden. I also added a tablespoon or two of sriracha. Loved the flavors together! At the end I poured off the remaining sauce and reduced it slightly in a saucepan so we could spoon some over the chicken. Will definitely make this again!

I thought this was a great recipe. I switched white sugar to brown sugar and added 2 TBSP of rice wine vinegar (but you could also just use white vinegar). I also think it needs to at least marinate for five hours.

If you want to make the marinade into the sauce, you should boil it in a pot to cook it to a safe temperature and add 1 1/2 TBSP of corn starch to thicken it.
User the honey hickory seasoning to add it to this and brought out even more flavors with the sauce and the baked tater tasted awesome with this chicken super full at the moment.
Great recipe! No need to marinate; it's just as good if you bring the ingredients to boil in a pot, pour over the chicken and bake.
I really enjoy this recipe, it's quick and easy, though someday I'm going to shoot for the more intricate recipe.
Easy to make; family enjoyed it. Made no changes.
A good, easy recipe. I thought it was a little sweet for me and will likely use less sugar next time... but in a pinch, a good option. Thanks!
It was delicious and taste just like teriyaki chicken back home in the island I just twicked it a little and added a little bit of island flava.
Great flavor! Just a little too sweet for my taste. Will reduce sugar next time. Used chicken breast and marinated then cooked on stovetop! Love the fresh ginger and garlic!
Very good. The only changes I made were using brown sugar instead.

Wow what an amazing recipe. I did tweak it a little did not use the white sugar instead I used brown sugar. I also added a whole can of pineapple with the juice. Put all the ingredients with the chicken legs into a turkey bag(Plastic). Let it sit in the refrigerator for about two or three hours. When ready to cook put the bag inside Aluminum tray. When I felt it was good to take out the bag I did and let it continue baking till it was ready. My husband and boys loved it my young one loved it so much he started to pick some off my plate. ?? All in All I will be making it again soon. Was delicious. Thank you so much for sharing your recipe with myself and others.
The brown sugar definitely works. Love the the almost burnt bits!
Did anyone fry the chicken instead of baking? I’m going to try it with chicken breasts.

Amazingly easy and SO delicious!!! I use ground ginger and minced garlic from a jar. It literally takes seconds to throw everything into the instant pot. Thirty minutes later I have fantastic teriyaki chicken. I don’t marinade but do cook it this long so it shreds and the flavor is throughout the meat. I double the recipe and triple the sauce so we can have some for dinner and I can put a few freezer meals away for lunches. Won’t ever buy teriyaki sauce again. Great for company too! Everyone LOVES it!!!
Awesome dish!

I was looking for a Teriyaki recipe and found this one however I didn’t have any ginger so I used an apple instead - threw everything in a bullet blender and marinated in a plastic bag for a couple of hours. Baked as instructed & it was great! I will definitely make again & will also try original recipe as well lol!
Delicious! I doubled the sauce so there was lots left over to smother the rice. I didn’t even have time to marinade as the recipe called for and it was very flavourful.

I also used brown sugar instead of white. I used low sodium soy sauce and not as much as recipe calls for. I added just a little bread crumbs on top of chicken. That’s just my preference. It was very easy to make and awesomely delicious!
This is really delicious! I did sub brown sugar for white as per other ratings. Yummy!

Wow is this one of the next marinades that I have found on this site. I used a whole chicken and cut it up into the thigh leg wing etc. I put it all in a gallon size bag and let marinate all day. I cooked and basted for one hour and oh boy this chicken is moist, flavorful and has a beautiful brown glaze on it. I used the extra marinade as a dipping sauce. I let it boil down on the stove for about 10’ and added a rouge to thicken it up. It was a little salty but still good. This recipe was soooo delicious that I made it again that same week. Everyone loved it. The only thing I did was add a run consisting of garlic and onion powder, cumin, pepper and a tiny pinch of cayenne pepper. I mixed it together and lifted the skin and rubbed the dry ingredients all over the meat. Then laid the skin back on. It really kicks up the chicken a notch and gives it a little spicy sweet bite to your mouth. I also used brown sugar instead of white. Thanks for the recipe.

This is a hit at my house. My fiancé asks for this at least once a week, sometimes twice. I let the chicken marinate in the teriyaki sauce for as long as I possibly can (the longer the better) so it marinates in the fridge for 2 days at least and what a difference it makes! I also use brown sugar. 100% recommend.. so yummy!
did not really care for it. The sauce was too thin and did not stick to chicken
This is a scrumptious recipe! I used boneless breasts and served it with brown rice and broccoli. I thickened the sauce with corn starch. This is a keeper!!
Best teryaki sauce recipe I've found so far. I hate buying bottled teriyaki because there's something very artificial about them. This is simple and delicious. The whole family loves it!

Best ever !!! I did it stove top to cut time and doubled the sauce and served over rice every one loved it ! Thank you soooo much I have been trying for years to make this ! So proud of my self right know !! Thanks!

Super easy and extremely tasty. Used a chicken breast, pounded thin and cut into chunks. One reviewer suggested using brown sugar, which I will try next time, but it was mighty fine as it was. To break the monotony of left-overs, add some dry-roasted peanuts. All in all, a can't-go-wrong dish.
I used chicken , thighs & wings and was very delicious
Hubby loved this good change
Just not the best teriyaki chicken.
Delicious! Worth the time to make it
Absolutely delicious! I used powdered ginger instead of fresh and I used boneless skinless chicken breast and baked at 350 for 30 minutes. They turned out amazing! Great recipe!
Very easy to make yet a crowd pleaser!
This recipe is awesome! I made some changes though, I cooked drumsticks only. Instead of sugar, I use honey, turn out perfect!
It was really goooood. Delicious and savory
My family loved was plain but still good
Used drumsticks and wings and cooked it on the stove for about 45 minutes. Turned out to be perfect.
It's simple and yet very tasty. I used gluten free soy sauce and and brown sugar and came out great.
Absolutely wonderful. Easy to prepare and wonderful tasting
Very simple ! I did some changes marinated the chicken then added the sauce. Kids love it.

This is my go-to recipe for easy terriyaki chicken...the only change I made was using brown sugar instead of granulated sugar...Also added some lemon juice, and some corn starch to reduce the sauce from being so watery.
My partner loved it! Used breast chicken fillet and brown sugar. Served with brown rice , buttered asparagus and carrots. :)
Very good, sometimes recipes don't look like what is suppose to look like at least for me but this one was easy and it looked and I m sure taste every bit as good as the picture showed!
Yummy, made as directed, except I marinated overnight because I didn't get time to make it that day. mmmmm
VERY GOOD. Entire family of 5 enjoyed it. I used brown sugar as many suggested and chicken breasts cut in large pieces. This will be a regular dinner for my crew.

This recipe is very good, and easy to make. Another great recipe with only 5 ingredients, all which I always have on hand. I used brown sugar and a splash of lemon juice. The sauce does come out thin, just thicken it in a saucepan with cornstarch. Freeze the leftover sauce and use as a dipping sauce.

Perfect.. sooo yummy..!!! i used chicken drumsticks, Worcester sauce, brown sugar, ginger powder, added lemon juice and ground black pepper then minced garlic... marinated overnight..!! the BEST..!!! my boyfriend and I loved it so much.. will cook this again SOON.. great recipe..!!!
Awesome! Better than any store bought teriyaki sauce. I actually did mine with breasts. Same amount of sugar and soy sauce. A little less ginger and garlic. Worked perfectly.
Very easy and delicious recipe, I added some been sprouts, onions and carrots.. Just loved it!!

I will make this again! The kids really liked it too. I will serve over rice and may make more sauce next time. The flavor is quite a bit stronger the second day. Next time, I would dilute the sauce with water. The kids loved the flavor the first day but thought it was too strong the second day.
My family loves this recipe it's easy and delicious :)

This turned out wonderful!! Everyone in the family ate it! I changed the following: Instead of 3/4 cup of sugar, I did 1/2 cup sugar and 1/4 of brown sugar. I also marinated it for a couple of hours before I cooked it. Hubs said that it wasn't the over bearing teriyaki flavor that we normally get. 

This is definitely going on the make again list.
Tasted pretty good. We would have liked it more if the sauce was thicker. If I were to try it again, perhaps brown sugar & some lemon juice might improve it.
Overall just average. Will not make this again.
MY WHOLE FAMILY LOVES IT I USE BREAST CHICKEN AND IT STILL COMES OUT DELICIOUS WITH SOME COOKED BROCCOLI...
very simple and delicious.my husband loved it

Phenomenal...i didn't have ginger so I just used soy sauce, garlic and regular sugar... Allspice and a little nutmeg. Marinated this for 15 hours since I forgot about it overnight...turned out really really good... This is now added to my arsenal

It was good. Better than store bought due to much less salty taste. I wouldn't say it was as amazing as all of the reviews though. I would make again, but modify with pineapple and honey maybe. It would be good to mix with veggies in a stir fry.
I used chicken breast strips and let the meat marinate all day. It was very yummy
my husband loved it!
Great recipe. I also used brown sugar instead of white sugar. I also throw in some sesame seeds.
This recipe is just great .. all family loved it, it's delicious and juicy and it's even more tasty with vinegar.

I also used brown sugar instead of white. My husband likes "moisture" in all his meats, so I marinaded thighs then cooked them in the marinade until they were 165 degrees. Extremely flavorful and moist enough for hubby.
I have tried this recipe and loving it ! Very very yummy and my family love this very much, better than those from bottled sauce.

Outstanding! I used agave nectar as I am trying to avoid sugar, chicken thighs as that is what I had thawed and we grilled it. I'll definitely keep this in my "recipe box" and fix again. The entire family liked it.
I followed the recipe as it is but felt it lacks flavor. Really easy to make though.
Used brown sugar unstead of white, thickened sauce with cornstarch and used extra sauce for stir fried noodles and veggies. Delicious!
Delicious as is! Makes quite a sticky mess to clean though.
This recipe is SO delicious! My boyfriend and his friend loved it. We did not have any leftovers. We scarfed them all up!
Turned out perfect.
I love this recipe.n I wouldnt change anything about it.

I made the marinade the night before and let the chicken marinade over night. I didn't have ginger, so it wasn't included in the dish. I also season the chicken with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.

I thought the chicken was alright, my boyfriend loved it (I guess that means I'll be making it again). Its defintely better than, what they serve in the bottle at the grocery stores.
Very good

This recipe was amazing! My family is pretty picky about their teriyaki sauce. I have not found a bottled version that we like. This is a definite keeper! I doubled the recipe, used low sodium soy sauce and used boneless, skinless chicken thighs. I baked in a pan. When the chicken was done, I took it out of the pan. I stirred into the sauce 2 tablespoons of cornstarch which I had stirred in cold water first. I cranked up the heat to 400 degrees and let it boil till it thickened. It mad a fabulous sauce to put over the chicken and rice. So fantastic. Next time I'm going to try with pineapple and add some acid as suggested. But as is, it's delicious. I wonder how it would taste with a flank steak?
Very simple and SO yummy!! Took advice of others and used brown sugar instead of white. A hit at the dinner table! Even with the teenagers!! :)

Wow! This recipe is so easy to prepare and as an experience cook this will be an easy presentation but as I can see, taste is absolutely great, because I am familiar already with teriyaki by pan and not by oven, so this is great, a great idea for me to try, only to make some innovative with presentation. Great!!!!

Great recipe! Chicken turned out beautiful and tasted great too. I am diabetic so I made a change -- instead of the 3/4 cup of granulated sugar, I used the equivilent in powdered stevia. To those individuals wanting to do the same, it is easier to mix stevia in warm/hot vs. cold. Soooo, heat-up that soy sauce before adding the stevia powder!
Also, I let the chicken marinate for about 8 hours and basted it every 6 to 10 minutes while cooking.
I like to use boneless, skinless chicken thighs for this recipe. I also like to grill the chicken instead of baking. This has become one of my family's favorite meals.
This was yummy. I thought it might be too sweet with all the sugar but it tasted so good my daughter took the leftovers for lunch.
Did not care for this one.
Great recipe. Great taste. Right amount of sweet.

Finally the perfect, easy recipe for Teriyaki Chicken. I used chicken fajitas cut them in thin strips and stir fried them. I also used brown sugar instead of the granulated it called for. My son loved it.
Great recipe! I did however follow other reviews and used brown sugar instead of white sugar. Very tender and flavorful!

In all honesty, I haven't tried this yet. I will be making it on Friday. However, a note to everyone. The saltiness could be due to the chicken. Most chickens are injected with a saline solution. Make sure the chicken you buy and use is not injected with saline.

Easy and Delicious! I followed the recipe exactly as is and it was finger licking good! Next time I'll try it with brown sugar as per other reviewers suggestions just to change it up a bit.
PS: Made it again with cut up chicken legs and brown sugar and equally delish!
I made this recipe using chicken wings. My grandchildren loved it. Next time I will use chicken breast for my husband and me.

I made a few changes to the recipe such as 1/2 cup brown sugar instead of the white sugar, next time I'll only use 1/4 cup because my bf found it too sweet. I also used 1/2 cup of orange juice, as recommended by someone else's review and 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger instead of the fresh ginger. I found the orange juice gave it a slightly different taste, but I enjoyed it. I also added 1 cup of broccoli, 1 cup of carrots and 1 cup of celery to it.

I absolutely love this recipe. It has become part of my regular favorites. It's so easy to prepare. I prepare it the night before and marinate overnight. The next day just stick it in the oven when I get home from work. Usually serve it with white rice.
The only teriyaki chicken recipe I will use or recommend!

Wow! I'm very impressed with this. I swaped out the granulated sugar and replaced it with brown sugar, let it all marinate for 1 hour, and baked as stated. Also, I used chicken breast rather than a whole chicken. I only needed about 42 minutes in a 13 by 9 inch dish at 350 uncovered, and it came out perfect! I also just dumped the contents (marinade and all) from my ziplock bag into the dish and spread it out. This is delicious restaurant quality!!
THIS WAS SO MOIST & DELICIOUS! I USED BONELESS CHICKEN BREAST & BAKED AT 350 FOR 30 MIN AND IT CAME OUT TO PERFECTION!! THANKS FOR SHARING YOUR YUMMY RECIPE!!!!

I loved how short, simple, and effection this recipe was. The only thing I didnt like was the saltiness, but you probably already heard that. But the reviews your have gotten turn this dish to paradise.
This was wonderful. I used brown sugar instead of white and added about half a cup of orange juice. It was delicious served with brown rice and the Sugared Asparagus from this site.
did not like it

I tried this recipe tonight for the first time, and, although I was so excited about it, the chicken didn't turn out as I had hoped. The marinade was over-the-top salty! It was so sodium-packed that my mom and I were not able to finish our chicken breast! I know I must have done something wrong because everyone else seems to love this recipe. Could someone please let me know what I may have done wrong? Should I have used "low-sodium" soya sauce?

This recipe just looks so good - I'd like to know how to make it right!

Thanks!

This is my first review, so bear with me. I absolutely LOVED this recipe. It was so easy and delicious. I added 1/2 cup of pineapple juice to it and put it in the crock-pot for three hours. The chicken tasted amazing! My family couldn't get enough. We will definitely be making this again in the near future.
Turned out delicious! I used chicken thighs and boneless, skinless chicken breasts. Tasted great the next day too.
